intro: Eriosyce taltalensis subsp. paucicostata, commonly known as the Taltal eriosyce, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of northern Chile, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. This subspecies is characterized by its dense, spiny stems and small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive, tubular shape. It is a low-growing plant, often found in rocky soils and coastal dunes.
